frame.name: Part_orientational
frame.definition:
<def-root>In this frame, there is a <fen>Part</fen> of a <fen>Whole</fen> in which the <fen>Part</fen> is defined with respect to the canonical or inherent orientation of the <fen>Whole</fen>. In cases where the <t>Target</t> is an adjective, it has a special relationship with the noun that it modifies such that a phrase which is a syntactic argument of the noun is semantically available to fill the argument structure of the adjective, as in
<ex>the <t>front</t> <fex name="Part">row</fex> <fex name="Whole">of the class</fex> </ex>
<ex>The <t>top</t> <fex name="Part">shelf</fex> <fex name="Whole">of the bookcase</fex> was lying on the floor.</ex>
<ex>The <t><fex name="Part">bottom</fex></t> was missing.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Whole">My</fex> <t>left</t> <fex name="Part">hand</fex> was numb.</ex>
<ex>He rested on the <fex name="Whole">cliff</fex><t><fex name="Part">top</fex></t></ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Part
FE.definition: <def-root>A piece of a larger <fen>Whole</fen>.<ex>The <t>top</t> <fex name="Part">shelf</fex> <fex name="Whole">of the bookcase</fex> was lying on the floor.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Part_Prop
FE.definition: <def-root>A property relating to the <fen>Part</fen> of a <fen>Whole</fen>.<ex>The <fex name="Part_Prop">white-painted</fex> <t><fex name="Part">front</fex></t> <fex name="Whole">of the house</fex> had 2 black doors.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Whole
FE.definition: <def-root>An undivided entity having all its <fen>Part</fen>s.<ex>The show takes place in the <t>West</t> <fex name="Part">wing</fex> <fex name="Whole">of the White House</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: top.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the highest or uppermost point, part, or surface.

lexUnit.name: bottom.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the lowest point, position, or part of something.

lexUnit.name: front.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the side or part of an object that presents itself to view or that is normally seen or used first.

lexUnit.name: back.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: 2a the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

lexUnit.name: side.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a position to the left or right of an object, place, or central point.

lexUnit.name: underside.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the bottom or lower side or surface of something

lexUnit.name: underbelly.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the vulnerable underside of a body or mass

lexUnit.name: peak.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the pointed top of a mountain.

lexUnit.name: back.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: in the opposite direction from the one that one is facing or travelling towards.

lexUnit.name: top.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: situated in the highest position or at the highest point or part of an object.

lexUnit.name: bottom.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: in the lowest position.

lexUnit.name: apex.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the top or highest part of something, especially one forming a point

lexUnit.name: base.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the lowest part or edge of something, especially the part on which it rests or is supported.

lexUnit.name: tip.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the pointed or rounded extremity of something slender or tapering.

lexUnit.name: rear.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the back or hindmost part of something.

lexUnit.name: foot.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the lower or lowest part of something vertical; the base or bottom.

lexUnit.name: face.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the surface of a thing, especially one that is presented to the view or has a particular function.

lexUnit.name: hind.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: attrib. (especially of a bodily part) situated at the back

lexUnit.name: rear.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: at the back.

lexUnit.name: heart.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the central, innermost, or vital part of something.

lexUnit.name: left.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the left-hand part, side, or direction.

lexUnit.name: left.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: on, towards, or relating to the side of a human body or of a thing which is to the west when the person or thing is facing north.

lexUnit.name: right.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: on, towards, or relating to the side of a human body or of a thing which is to the east when the person or thing is facing north.

lexUnit.name: right.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the right-hand part, side, or direction.

lexUnit.name: crest.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the top of a ridge, wave, etc.

lexUnit.name: summit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the highest point of a hill or mountain.

lexUnit.name: east.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: lying towards, near, or facing the east.

lexUnit.name: west.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: lying towards, near, or facing the west.

lexUnit.name: north.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: lying towards, near, or facing the north

lexUnit.name: south.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: lying towards, near, or facing the south.

lexUnit.name: southern.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: situated, directed towards, or facing the south.

lexUnit.name: northern.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: situated in, directed towards, or facing the north.

lexUnit.name: northernmost.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: situated in the most northern position or direction

lexUnit.name: southernmost.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: situated in the most southern position or direction

lexUnit.name: eastern.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: situated in, directed towards, or facing the east.

lexUnit.name: easternmost.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: situated in the most eastern position or direction

lexUnit.name: western.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: situated in, directed towards, or facing the west.

lexUnit.name: westernmost.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: situated in the most western position or direction

lexUnit.name: north.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the northern part of a country, region, or town.

lexUnit.name: south.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the southern part of a country, region, or town.

lexUnit.name: west.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the west of a country, region, or town.

lexUnit.name: east.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the eastern part of a country, region, or town.

lexUnit.name: northwest.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the north-western part of a country, region, or town.

lexUnit.name: north-south.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: between the northern and the southern parts.
